edu.iastate.cs228.hw1

Class World

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.iastate.cs228.hw1.World

  • public class World
extends java.lang.Object
    The world is represented as a square grid of size width X width.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      Living[][] grid 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      World(int w)
      Constructor that builds a w X w grid without initializing it.

      Default constructor reads from a file
      World(java.lang.String[][] testworld) 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getWidth()
      Return the width of the world.
      void randomInit()
      Initialize the world by randomly assigning to every square of the grid one of BADGER, FOX, RABBIT, GRASS, or EMPTY.

    • Method Detail

      • getWidth

        public int getWidth()
        Return the width of the world.
        Returns:
        the width

      • randomInit

        public void randomInit()
        Initialize the world by randomly assigning to every square of the grid one of BADGER, FOX, RABBIT, GRASS, or EMPTY. Every animal starts at age 0.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Output the world grid. For each square, output the first letter of the living form occupying the square. If the living form is an animal, then output the age of the animal followed by a blank space; otherwise, output two blanks.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • write

        public void write(java.lang.String outputFileName)
           throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Write the world grid to an output file. Also useful for saving a randomly generated world for debugging purpose.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException
